intro: Gomphia affinis, commonly known as the common gomphia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its inflorescence consists of clustered spikelets. Gomphia affinis is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitat.
